Description: Terracotta female figure. Fragment of head only with long hair flowing down back of head, covered by a veil in a turban-shaped headdress. Large earrings and necklace visible. Long narrow face with strong features and large eyes. Traces of red (hair) and black paint in patches, obscured by black concretions or mould. Cypriot clay pressed into two moulds, subsequently joined creating a hollow figure. Fine yellow-buff fabric, with frequent black, grey, white and red inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8(?)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

These figurines with narrow, trapezoidal and firm features, fall within Gjerstad’s ‘Western Neo-Cypriote style’ he dates to 570 to 520 BC (Gjerstad 1948,108 pls 9, 7). A good parallel dated to the end of the seventh century BC (Fourrier & Queyrel 1998, 201, no.303, AM3575), though other similar examples from Syria date from the end of the 7th to the 6th centuries BC (Fourrier & Queyrel 1998, 198, no. 295, 175, no. 247-8 N2333, AM3562, AM3568). Similar figurines from the Achna workshops date to the 6th century BC (Karageorghis 1999, pls 17.4, 38.1-2, 56.7, Types I(ix)170, IV(iii)6-7, VII(ii)11). This agrees with Petrie’s suggested 6th century BC date for Stratum 3 in the temple of Apollo (Petrie 1886, 14). Fourrier, S. & Queyrel, A. 1998. L’art de modeleurs d’argile Antiquités de chypre coroplastique. Musée du Louvre, Paris. Gjerstad, E. 1948. The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV, Part 2: The Cypro-Geometric, Cypro-Archaic and Cypro-Classical periods. Stockholm, The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Karageorghis, J. 1999. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus. VB. The Cypro-Archaic Period small female figurines. Nicosia, University of Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.013) (Phase 3)
